definition: to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: He prevailed on the lieutenant to send in a short note.
sentences.chinese: 他說動那個副官，遞上了一張簡短的便條進去。

sentences.english: Maybe I could convince them to start serving biscuits.
sentences.chinese: 也許我能說動他們開始賣餅乾呢。

sentences.english: When a lion bites a urus, you will say how wild and cruel.
sentences.chinese: 人常說動物兇猛，說獅子殺死野牛的撕咬是多麼殘忍。

sentences.english: The father finally dissuaded his son from leaving school.
sentences.chinese: 那父親終於說動了他的兒子不輟學。

sentences.english: I can't believe you let him talk you into this.
sentences.chinese: 我真不相信你能被他說動了。

sentences.english: Some veterinarians say animals do experience it, or a version of it.
sentences.chinese: 有些獸醫說動物確實體驗了這種症狀或者類似的症狀。

sentences.english: "People are getting harder to impress," Steinberg said.
